intro: Meyenia vogeliana, commonly known as the Vogel's meyenia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Meyenia vogeliana is often found growing in rocky or sandy habitats, making it a hardy and resilient species.
